Name: Wooden shabti
Description: A large painted wooden shabti, finely modelled with a delicate face. The arms and hands are carved and painted with an elaborate pattern in red, black and yellow, possibly designed to resemble protective wings. The tripartite wig is painted blue-black, decorated on the tips with yellow and red. The front of the figure has suffered more damage than the back, here a basket can be seen on the right shoulder on a white background and a flagellum or other object on the other shoulder. The text, mostly lost, is in six horizontal bands on a yellow background within a red border.
